segment.source: Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services is a test framework used to automate running assessments that measure performance, reliability and functionality on multiple computers in a lab environment.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services is a test framework used to automate running assessments that measure performance, reliability and functionality on multiple computers in a lab environment.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services is a test framework used to automate running assessments that measure performance, reliability and functionality on multiple computers in a lab environment.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services is a test framework used to automate running assessments that measure performance, reliability and functionality on multiple computers in a lab environment.

segment.source: It helps you eliminate fragmented, error-prone, expensive, pre-deployment test processes, and enables you to replace multiple steps and inconsistent tools with just one tool.
segment.target: It helps you eliminate fragmented, error-prone, expensive, pre-deployment test processes, and enables you to replace multiple steps and inconsistent tools with just one tool.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services is included with the Windows ADK.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services is included with the Windows ADK.

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Services - Client (Windows ASC) is the graphical user interface that interacts with Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Services - Client (Windows ASC) is the graphical user interface that interacts with Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: This enables you to manage settings and assets, such as which lab computers to test, which images should be applied to those computers, and which assessments should be run on the test computers.
segment.target: This enables you to manage settings and assets, such as which lab computers to test, which images should be applied to those computers, and which assessments should be run on the test computers.

segment.source: You can use Windows ASC to monitor the progress of a running job, and to view and compare the results that were produced.
segment.target: You can use Windows ASC to monitor the progress of a running job, and to view and compare the results that were produced.

segment.source: Additional benefits include being able to import results into a central database for consolidated report generation.
segment.target: Additional benefits include being able to import results into a central database for consolidated report generation.

segment.source: The following diagram shows the workflow for the first-time use of Windows Assessment Services and the client UI:
segment.target: The following diagram shows the workflow for the first-time use of Windows Assessment Services and the client UI:

segment.target: windows asc workflow diagram

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Services Technical Reference provides technical details, advanced how-to information, troubleshooting and related resources.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Services Technical Reference provides technical details, advanced how-to information, troubleshooting and related resources.

segment.source: To learn how to use Windows ASC in an end-to-end scenario, see the Windows Assessment Services step-by-step guide.
segment.target: To learn how to use Windows ASC in an end-to-end scenario, see the Windows Assessment Services step-by-step guide.
